item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, December 14, 2024 at 3:30 AM UTC
item.description:
1. macOS 15.2 breaks the ability to copy the OS to another drive (135 points | 42 comments)
2. Luon programming language (78 points | 30 comments)
3. Sharing new research, models, and datasets from Meta FAIR (178 points | 25 comments)
4. Show HN: Performant intracontinental public transport routing in Rust (24 points | 2 comments)
5. Htmx 2.0.4 Released (54 points | 9 comments)
6. Exotic new superconductors delight and confound (153 points | 41 comments)
7. My PhD advisor rewrote himself in bash (2010) (61 points | 24 comments)
8. The Pentium FDIV bug, reverse-engineered (125 points | 24 comments)
9. Mysterious tablet with unknown language unearthed in Georgia (32 points | 12 comments)
10. Making my first robot as a software engineer (217 points | 26 comments)
11. Show HN: @smoores/epub, a JavaScript library for working with EPUB publications (96 points | 38 comments)
12. Show HN: Imposter Attack – Among Us-themed infrared game made with ESP32 (154 points | 25 comments)
13. McKinsey and Company to pay $650M for role in opioid crisis (123 points | 49 comments)
14. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (153 points | 18 comments)
15. Ask HN: What should I do with meet.hn? (157 points | 107 comments)
16. Web Origami, for making websites where you can understand how they’re made (169 points | 45 comments)
17. Donald Bitzer has died (157 points | 17 comments)
18. Idiomatic Errors in Clojure (7 points | 2 comments)
19. An Italian town that built its own sun (2021) (91 points | 32 comments)
20. Energy-Harvesting Electronic Holiday Card 2024 (3 points | discuss)
21. OpenAI whistleblower found dead in San Francisco apartment (362 points | 133 comments)
22. Elon Musk wanted an OpenAI for-profit (410 points | 432 comments)
23. Pompeii experts back Pliny's account of Mount Vesuvius eruption date (33 points | 16 comments)
24. SCCS roach motel (43 points | 11 comments)
25. MarkItDown: Python tool for converting files and office documents to Markdown (215 points | 59 comments)
26. Test (454 points | 103 comments)
27. HyperDX (YC S22) is hiring engineers to build open source observability ( | hide)
28. "All your base are belong to us" intro to my 2004 MIT Spam Conference talk (56 points | 24 comments)
29. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it’s going (377 points | 187 comments)
30. 0x01 – Killing Windows Kernel Mitigations (83 points | 6 comments)
